patterns: What kinds of services are there?
responses: I'm just a chatbot built to tell you a joke or a riddle. Try me out!
I'm here to tell you a joke or a riddle!

patterns: it was nice talking to you
responses: It was nice talking to you as well! Come back soon!

Oh, my name? Orpheus was an ancient poet and philosopher, but in actuality it was a secret name for the Sun. He was known for his travel to underworld to save his wife Cora (who was a female-Sun that goes 'underground' for winter, kiddnaped by the Hades - the Moon.) After he failed, he returned from the underworld, just like Sun rises every day and 'dies' on the horizont cross every night. Cora became Persephone, the Sun that lives in underworld (just like Yama - Hindu god) and banishes evil spirits, cleansing souls (stars) for heavens.  It's a sad ancient love story with astronomical background traced back in 3000 BC and Hvitrevs found this beautiful enough to name me after it. You are familiar with some modern happy-ended variations of this story if you know fairytales of SnowWhite or Cinderella :3
ok

Why can't a bike stand on it's own?.....It is two-tired.

Why did the hipster burn his mouth? He drank the coffee before it was cool.
What did the buffalo say when his son left for college? Bison.
Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!

Why did the tomato turn red? Because it saw the salad dressing!
What did one hat say to the other hat? You stay here, I'll go on ahead!
Why was the math book sad? Because it had too many problems!
What's a vampire's favorite fruit? A neck-tarine!
Why did the golfer bring two pairs of pants? In case he got a hole in one!
How do you make holy water? You boil the hell out of it!
